review.author: DevOps (Codex)
findings: Sync→async logging fix: buffered-file-writer.js with 500ms flush interval, backpressure cap at 2000 lines.
Flushing guard prevents concurrent appendFile calls; re-check ensures no data loss during flush.
logger.js, diagnostic-log.js, hivemind-app console-message all converted to buffered writer.
Shutdown path calls flush() with catch — graceful data preservation on exit.
Timer uses unref() so it doesn't block process exit.
Data loss window: max 0.5s of logs on abrupt crash — acceptable tradeoff for no event-loop starvation.
Remaining appendFileSync callers (memory-store, screenshot-handlers, war-room) not in hot path — fine as-is.
Tests properly await _flushForTesting() before asserting file writes.

_docs.rule: If change_type !== 'routine', reviewer model MUST differ from author model
_docs.workflow: 1. Author fills author+author_model+change_type. 2. Reviewer fills reviewer+model+result+findings. 3. Pre-commit checks result=approved and cross-model rule. 4. After commit, review.json is reset to pending.
